<jbr>
> What I really want is a Bag, dammit. Why didn't Java give us a Bag?!
</jbr>

not to flog the "collection assertion" dead horse too much longer,
but to treat an array or List as a bag, could you simply sort it and
then compare equals()?

String[] s1, s2;
// ...
Arrays.sort(s1);
Arrays.sort(s2);
assertEquals("string arrays", Arrays.asList(s1), Arrays.asList(s2));

that said, it does seem weird that the javadoc for
java.util.Collection would go so far as to say that bags should
implement Collection directly, but then not provide an implementation.
actually, it wouldn't be terribly difficult to write--but, why have
umpteen hand-rolled Bag implementations when Sun could provide the
one?  last thing we need is to spend time writing collection classes.

--p
